items.title: Freitag’s newest messenger bag is made from trash to last
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Freitag has released the F685 Henry messenger bag made from recycled materials like seatbelts and plastic bottles.
- The bag is heavy, water-resistant, durable, and every piece is unique.
- Priced at $330, it comes with a three-year repair warranty.
- It's expandable from 13 liters to 20 liters, suited for daily use.
- Features include a padded shoulder strap, external pockets, and reflectors for visibility.
- The Velcro closures are loud and may collect debris over time.
- Weighing 3.26 pounds, it is heavier than some comparable bags but aims for longevity.

items.title: Science Saru’s The Ghost in the Shell series gets a new teaser trailer
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- A new teaser trailer for Science Saru’s *The Ghost in the Shell* anime series was announced on April 12, 2025.
- The teaser consists of concept art resembling the original manga.
- It feature’s the series' main staff including director Moko-chan and scriptwriter EnJoe Toh.
- The series is set to be released in 2026, but details about a potential Netflix release in the US are not disclosed.
- Earlier teasers featured hand-drawn storyboards and key animation that pay homage to the manga's style.

items.title: Bungie’s slick-looking Marathon shooter arrives on September 23rd
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Bungie's new game, Marathon, is set for release on September 23rd, available on PS5, Xbox Series S/X, and PC with full cross-play and cross-save.
- An alpha test will be available starting April 23rd, revealing the unique PvPvE extraction shooter gameplay where players, known as 'Runners', scavenge against other teams.
- The game is set in a sci-fi universe in 2850 on Tau Ceti IV, featuring different classes of Runners, each with unique abilities, including stealth and offensive capabilities.
- Players can team up with up to three others or play solo and will face PvE enemies as well as rival Runners for loot.
- Bungie is aiming to distinguish Marathon from other failed shooters in the market, and the pricing strategy remains unclear; it will not be free-to-play.

items.title: Apple’s Mythic Quest has come to an end
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The fourth season finale of *Mythic Quest*, the Apple TV Plus comedy, will have a new ending next week.
- *Mythic Quest* will not be renewed for a fifth season, as reported by *Variety*.
- Executive producers expressed gratitude to the cast, crew, and fans, stating they are making a final update to the last episode to provide a proper goodbye.

items.title: The Best Garmin Watches for Training and Everyday Life
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin is a well-regarded brand for fitness trackers and smartwatches, popular among athletes and outdoor enthusiasts.
- Garmin watches offer features like fitness tracking, GPS navigation, and long battery life, catering to a range of users.
- Recent changes have introduced a paywall for new features, contrary to previous statements by the company.
- The article provides recommendations for various Garmin models suited for runners, endurance sports, budget buyers, and users looking to replace Fitbits.
- Key models discussed include the Forerunner 265 for runners, Epix 2 Pro for endurance sports, and Fenix 8.
- The Forerunner 265 features an OLED display and dual-frequency GPS, priced at $450.
- The Epix 2 Pro provides comprehensive fitness features and is size-inclusive, starting at $750.
- Garmin's Fenix 8 combines elements from its flagship multisport watch with advanced tracking capabilities, but at a higher starting price than earlier models.

items.title: Trump Excludes Smartphones, Computers, Chips from Tariffs
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The Trump administration has exempted smartphones, laptops, and other electronics from tariffs, including imports from China.
- U.S. Customs and Border Protection updated its guidance to include hard drives, processors, and memory chips in the exemption.
- This decision follows a 90-day pause on higher tariffs for most countries while increasing rates for Chinese imports.

items.title: There’s nothing wrong with a thong made out of a keyboard
items.author: Jasmine Ting
items.summary:
- Julia Fox showcases retro-tech fashion combining Y2K aesthetics and old electronics, promoting the Right to Repair movement.
- Fashion nostalgia is evident as younger generations gravitate towards wearable tech transformed into jewelry and clothing.
- Designers like Nicole McLaughlin and Myra Magdalen creatively upcycle vintage electronics into avant-garde fashion pieces.
- The trend highlights an appreciation for older tech's personality, contrasting sleek modern devices.
- Streetwear brand Drought pays homage to childhood memories through nostalgic designs without using physical relics.

items.title: Blue Prince will steal your time just like Balatro
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Blue Prince is an architectural puzzle mystery game by Dogubomb.
- You inherit a mansion with 45 rooms and must find the secret 46th room.
- The core mechanic involves drafting rooms within a 5x9 grid, each with varying door configurations.
- You begin each day with 50 steps, requiring strategic planning to progress.
- The game encourages note-taking for complex puzzles and interconnected room functions.
- It includes various types of rooms that offer distinct benefits for gameplay.
- The absence of colorblind settings has been recognized, with developers working on a solution.
- The narrative, while present, is secondary to the puzzle-solving experience.
- The game is available on Xbox, PlayStation, and PC.

items.title: Big Tech cozied up to Trump — it’s not getting much in return
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- President Trump appeared to have support from Big Tech at first but is now causing them collateral damage in a global trade war.
- European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suggested a potential levy on digital services' advertising revenues if tariff negotiations fail.
- Tech CEOs, including Mark Zuckerberg, are facing increased pressure, with potential fines for Meta and Apple under the EU's Digital Markets Act.
- Elon Musk's support for Trump has impacted his popularity in the US, reflecting on Tesla's declining stock value and changes in purchasing options in China.
- TikTok faces significant challenges due to aggressive tariffs, leading to a precarious business position amid ongoing negotiations with U.S. officials and China's commerce ministry's resistance to intervention.

items.title: Netflix is testing a new OpenAI-powered search
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Netflix is testing a new search feature powered by OpenAI.
- The search allows users to look for content based on specific moods.
- Currently available for iOS users in Australia and New Zealand, with plans to expand to the US soon.
- Feature queries go beyond genres and actors' names.
- It is an opt-in feature, still in the beta phase, with no plans for platforms outside of iOS yet.

items.title: The Best iPhones: A Comprehensive Guide to Apple's Latest Models
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Apple’s iPhone 16 series has been released, including the affordable iPhone 16E and features from iOS 18.1.
- Initial reviews suggest the new AI capabilities are not groundbreaking and regular updates will continue into 2025.
- Testing methodology involves using each reviewed phone for a week under various conditions.
- Recommendations made include options for both compact and larger device fans, highlighting the need for a balanced feature set at a reasonable price.
- Significant improvements noted in battery life and performance in the basic iPhone 16 and 16 Plus models.
- The iPhone 16’s camera has received upgrades, including a new Camera Control feature and various photographic styles.
- The iPhone 16 Pro offers a new 5x zoom lens and improved ultrawide camera; it starts at $999.
- The iPhone 16 Plus, praised for its battery life, offers a larger screen and remains lightweight, priced at $899.
- The iPhone 16E is highlighted as the best inexpensive option at $599, recommended for its reliable performance but lacks some features compared to higher models.

items.title: Baldur's Gate 3 is getting 12 new subclasses next week
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Patch 8 for Baldur's Gate 3 is set to launch on April 15th, introducing 12 new subclasses, crossplay, and a photo mode.
- This update will be the last major patch for the game, which was announced in November 2024.
- Each main class will receive an additional subclass, with the full list available in a November post from Larian Studios.
- Crossplay functionality will allow multiplayer gaming across different platforms.
- A Twitch stream about Patch 8 will be hosted by Larian on April 16th at 9AM ET.

items.title: This algorithm wasn’t supposed to keep people in jail, but it does in Louisiana
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- Louisiana uses the TIGER algorithm to determine parole eligibility based on risk scores.  
- The algorithm was intended for rehabilitation but now solely determines parole outcomes, often based on historical data.  
- Many inmates, including those with positive rehabilitation efforts, are denied parole due to moderate or high-risk scores, raising concerns about racial and demographic bias.  
- Governor Jeff Landry has implemented laws effectively eliminating parole for certain prisoners, marking a significant shift in the parole system.

items.title: YouTube’s new AI tool generates free background music for videos
You can run Doom on this $666 collector’s edition box
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Limited Run Games announces a collector’s edition of Doom, featuring a box that can play the game itself.
- The 'Will It Run Edition' is priced at $666.66 and will be available for preorder on April 18, 2025.
- Includes additional accessories such as four cassette tapes of the game’s soundtrack, a Cacodemon figurine, and a unique Cacodemon-shaped handheld game console.
- The edition features multiple Doom games, enhanced visuals, modern controller support, and various accessibility options.

items.title: ChatGPT is transforming LinkedIn users into really dull dolls
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- ChatGPT's image generator spurred a new LinkedIn trend of users creating AI-generated toy versions of themselves.
- The “AI Action Figure” variant has become popular, featuring users as toys in blister packs with accessories like laptops and coffee cups.
- The trend has spread to platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok, but is not as popular as the previous Studio Ghibli art trend.
- Concerns over copyright and ethical issues noted with the Ghibli trend have yet to arise with this new trend.
- While LinkedIn is the primary platform for this trend, engagement is low, with brands like Mac and NYX jumping in, but no major celebrities have participated.

items.title: You can save up to $1,800 on Samsung’s last-gen Frame TV
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Samsung has launched discounts on its 2024 Frame TV models following the release of its 2025 lineup.
- The 85-inch Frame TV is now priced at $2,498, a discount of $1,800, available at retailers like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0CVS9BFH4?tag=theverge02-20), [Best Buy](https://howl.link/35xqedys9kqqi), and [Samsung’s online store](https://howl.link/8ntbtr1rwzu4e).
- Smaller models like the 43-inch and 75-inch are available for $797.99 ($200 off) and $1,997.99 ($1,000 off) respectively.
- The Frame TV features a unique design with an anti-glare matte panel, showcasing artwork when not in use. It supports a 120Hz refresh rate and various streaming apps, along with HDMI 2.1 compatibility.
- The 2025 models include enhanced features like a 144Hz refresh rate and a Neo QLED Mini-LED panel but the last-gen model is still highly recommended for its aesthetics and quality.

items.title: South of Midnight is a game worth hollerin’ about
items.author: Ash Parrish

items.title: DoorDash is expanding into sidewalk robot delivery in the US
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- DoorDash partners with Coco to expand sidewalk robot deliveries to the US, currently live in Los Angeles and Chicago.
- Nearly 600 merchants are participating, allowing robot delivery of food and goods.
- The Coco partnership supports DoorDash's vision to become a "multi-modal" delivery platform.
- DoorDash has completed over 100,000 deliveries with Coco during the pilot phase worldwide.
- Delivery robots face challenges, including monitoring to avoid getting stuck or vandalized.

items.title: Buckle up for more subscriptions
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Garmin has introduced a new subscription for the Garmin Connect app, adding premium features that were previously free.
- Polar has also launched a premium subscription called Polar Fitness Plan, requiring long-time users to pay for previously free training plans.
- The trend towards subscriptions in the wearable technology sector has been influenced by the shift from hardware to services, starting with events like Apple’s in 2019.
- Experts suggest that rising hardware costs due to tariffs may push companies to increase subscription services as a revenue model.
- There is consumer resistance to paying for previously free features, as evidenced by backlash against subscription models from various tech companies.

items.title: Apple’s Siri upgrade may arrive in fall
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Apple may release upgraded Siri features by fall 2025, potentially including photo editing and sending.
- The anticipated features were initially expected with iOS 18.
- Internal delays attributed to leadership changes and budget constraints for AI chips.

items.title: Bring your vinyl to the beach with Toshiba’s new portable wireless record player
items.author: Andrew Liszewski

items.title: The Verge is nominated for two Webby Awards — help us win them!
items.author: Victoria Barrios

items.title: The moms are thrifting on Instagram
items.author: Rachel Lobdell
items.summary:
- A growing number of moms are transitioning from resale platforms like Poshmark to Instagram for thrifting, creating a more personal shopping experience.
- Instagram resellers build strong community bonds with their customers, often sharing personal connections and styles.
- The resale industry is projected to significantly grow, outpacing the broader retail sector by 2027, driven by millennials and Gen Z's interest in sustainable shopping.

items.title: Tesla’s latest Cybertruck has longer range and the cheapest price yet
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Tesla introduces a new entry-level Cybertruck priced at $69,990 before federal credit.
- The new model features a single RWD motor, reduced towing capacity (7,500 lbs), and lacks several features from AWD models.
- It offers a range of up to 350 miles, or 362 miles with a soft tonneau cover, which costs an additional $750.
- Acceleration is slower (0-60 mph in 6.2 seconds vs. 4.1 seconds for AWD).
- Interior features textile seats and lacks a rear seat infotainment touchscreen.
- Previous RWD model with a lower range was not released; this model is now available for order in the US, Mexico, and Saudi Arabia.
- Tesla faces challenges in selling Cybertrucks, reportedly selling only 50,000 units despite over a million reservations in 2024.

items.title: Pixel Watch 4 leaks suggest Google is doubling down on battery again
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Leaks suggest that the upcoming Pixel Watch 4 focuses on improved battery life.
- The watch is reported to be 14.3mm thick, up from 12.3mm, indicating potential for a larger battery.
- Renders show the removal of charging pins, possibly allowing for faster charging without wear issues.
- The watch is expected to be available in two sizes.
- Current battery life improvements in WearOS still lag behind competitors like OnePlus, Samsung, and Apple watches.

items.title: ‘Book Boyfriends’ and ‘Shadow Daddies’: the men cashing in on romantasy
items.author: Decca Muldowney
items.summary:
- Actor Zach Harrison performs as Cassian, a character from Sarah J. Maas’ romantasy series, at fantasy balls across the US.
- Romantasy, boosted by BookTok, is now a $471 million industry, with significant sales and popularity.
- Fantasy balls, costing $100 to $400 for tickets, include dancing, photo ops, and performers portraying beloved characters.
- The trend reflects a desire for escapism following the COVID-19 pandemic, with performers investing heavily in costumes and training.
- TikTok has recognized the value of bookish content, leading to an expansion into the publishing industry with a focus on romantasy-related works.

items.title: Doctor Who’s new companion is going to keep him on his toes
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
• Doctor Who's new season introduces Belinda Chandra, played by Varada Sethu, as a new companion alongside existing character Ruby Sunday.
• Belinda is an overworked A&E nurse who is unaware of the Doctor's extraterrestrial adventures and takes charge when necessary.
• Showrunner Russell T. Davies designed the interpersonal dynamic to focus on equals, with Belinda challenging the Doctor's usual leadership role.
• Davies was inspired to create Belinda's role based on emergency room work, emphasizing the critical and often underappreciated role of nurses.
• The Doctor, portrayed by Ncuti Gatwa, is on a journey to connect emotionally while chasing after Belinda, leading to significant character development for him.

items.title: How the tech world is responding to tariff chaos
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The article discusses the unpredictable nature of the Trump administration’s tariff policies affecting the tech industry.
- Major companies like Nintendo are delaying pre-orders and reassessing prices due to tariff chaos, while startups are struggling to maintain business viability.
- AI topics discussed include Meta's AI benchmark gaming and various challenges faced by companies like Apple and Shopify.

items.title: Meta goes to trial to avoid a breakup
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Meta is set to face the FTC in a trial starting on April 14, challenging its acquisitions of Instagram and WhatsApp as anticompetitive.
- The FTC alleges that these acquisitions neutralized potential competitors, while Meta claims it has fostered growth and faced competition.
- The trial could significantly impact the social media landscape, with possible outcomes including a forced breakup of Meta's acquisitions.

items.title: Why Nintendo can get away with a $450 Switch 2 price
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the Switch 2 would cost $450, which is higher than the Japan-only model priced at $333.
- The price difference makes more sense due to changes in the exchange rate between the US dollar and Japanese yen.
- Since the original Switch's launch in 2017, inflation has significantly affected prices in the US but not as much in Japan.
- The dollar is now worth significantly more in Japan, leading to potential misinterpretation of price fairness.
- Nintendo's pricing strategy has been influenced by a lack of competition in handheld gaming, allowing them to command higher prices.

items.title: ChatGPT will now remember your old conversations
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
• OpenAI enhances ChatGPT with a memory upgrade to recall past conversations, aligning with its goal to develop personalized AI systems.
• The update builds on the existing memory feature allowing users to manually save memories and improve responses based on past chats.
• The feature is rolling out to paying subscribers and is not available in the EU and other regions due to regulations; users can opt-out of memory features if desired.

items.title: China calls US a ‘joke’ as it raises tariff for final time
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- China has raised its tariff on US goods to 125%, stating it will not go higher.
- The increase is seen as a response to the US's tariff policies, which have risen significantly since an initial 10% imposed by Trump.
- China warns that further US tariffs would mean the US could become an "economic joke" and hints at possible additional retaliatory measures, including reduced imports of US films.

items.title: Microsoft is about to launch Recall for real this time
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Microsoft is rolling out a preview of Recall, a feature for capturing screenshots on Copilot Plus PCs, to Windows Insiders.
- Recall was initially set to launch in June but faced delays due to security concerns.
- The feature was later intended for an October launch, which was also postponed for user safety.
- A preview version was released to Windows Insiders in November for Qualcomm and later for Intel and AMD Copilot Plus PCs.
- Users must opt in to save snapshots with Recall and can pause this feature at any time.

items.title: Bluesky gets a revamped search page and emoji reactions in DMs
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Bluesky updates to version 1.100 with a new "Explore" search page.
- Explore page features trending topics, suggested accounts, and starter packs.
- Users can now react to direct messages with emojis, similar to other chat apps.

items.title: Stunts are finally getting their own category at the Oscars
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The Oscars will introduce a stunt design category starting from the 100th awards ceremony in 2027.
- The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences acknowledges the importance of stunt design in filmmaking.
- Specific eligibility rules for the new award have yet to be announced, with details pending from the Academy's Board of Governors.
- Previously, only two honorary Oscars have been awarded to stunt performers.

items.title: Razer’s PC-to-mobile streaming platform is now available
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Razer has launched its platform for streaming PC games to mobile devices at native resolutions and refresh rates.
- The Razer PC Remote Play app is available on the [App Store](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/razer-pc-remote-play/id6502818047) and [Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.razer.neuron&gl=1), compatible with Windows 11, iOS 18, and Android 14.
- Built on the Moonlight streaming client, it requires Razer Cortex game launcher on PCs and Razer Nexus game launcher on mobile.
- The app now includes AV1 video codec for improved quality and supports the Razer Kishi Ultra controller for enhanced gaming experience.
- Fully compatible with connected keyboards, mice, and trackpads for iPad users, suitable for FPS gaming.

items.title: NHTSA staffers evaluating self-driving car risks fired by DOGE
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Approximately 30 NHTSA staff were fired by Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) in February 2025.
- Affected staff were part of the office assessing self-driving car risks, raising concerns over diminished regulatory capabilities.
- The firings occurred amidst ongoing NHTSA investigations into Tesla's automated features, which have a high number of reported crashes.
- Victims' families have urged regulatory protections due to fears of reduced oversight under DOGE's influence.
- A new NHTSA framework easing regulation on self-driving cars was released before the firings, contingent on increased data sharing by companies.

items.title: Garmin’s new cycling headlight includes a 4K incident camera
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Garmin introduces the Varia Vue, a cycling headlight with a built-in 4K camera for incident recording.
- The device is priced at $549.99 and is available via Garmin's online store and Amazon.
- Features include up to six hours of 4K recording, electronic image stabilization, and the ability to upload videos to the Garmin Vault with a subscription.

items.title: OnePlus won’t say why its Watch 3 suddenly costs $170 more than promised
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- OnePlus Watch 3 price increased from $329.99 to $499, a markup of $170 or roughly 52%.
- The company has not communicated the reason for the price hike, with spokesperson stating no additional comments are available.
- Speculation suggests the price increase may be related to tariffs imposed by President Trump on products from China, with tariffs currently at 145%.

items.title: Vampire Survivors will let you share saves across platforms — but not on PlayStation
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Cross-saves for Vampire Survivors launched today but are not available on PlayStation due to a legal issue.
- Developer Poncle stated chances for PlayStation cross-saves are "very slim" but will continue working with Sony.
- Cross-saves available on Android, iOS, PC, and Xbox, with Nintendo Switch availability coming later.
- A new free DLC titled Emerald Diorama based on the SaGa franchise has also been released alongside a chicken-themed update.

items.title: Mike Flanagan is adapting Stephen King’s Carrie for Amazon
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Mike Flanagan is developing a series adaptation of Stephen King's *Carrie* for Amazon.
- The show will consist of eight episodes, with Flanagan serving as writer, showrunner, and director for some episodes.
- Actresses Summer H. Howell and Siena Agudong are reportedly in talks for the lead roles of Carrie White and Sue Snell.
- This adaptation follows numerous previous versions of *Carrie*, with the original film released in 1976.
- Flanagan has a strong history of adapting Stephen King's works, with notable projects including *Doctor Sleep* and *Gerald's Game*.

items.title: Canva is now in the coding and spreadsheet business
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Canva launches Visual Suite 2.0, integrating design and productivity tools.
- New features include coding, photo editing, spreadsheets, and AI assistance.
- Users can collaborate on documents, presentations, animations, and websites in a unified interface.
- Canva Sheets allows for creative spreadsheet creation and data visualization with AI.
- Canva Code acts as a generative AI assistant for coding tasks without traditional coding tools.
- New AI chatbot simplifies access to Canva's generative AI offerings for quick edits and content creation.

items.title: Sonos appoints software veteran Hugo Barra to its board after app troubles
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Sonos appoints Hugo Barra to its board of directors, replacing Mike Volpi, who served for 15 years.
- Barra has held senior positions at Google, Xiaomi, and Meta, and is currently the co-founder of /dev/agents.
- His addition is part of Sonos' strategy to improve its app and overall performance following previous issues.
- Sonos is also cancelling its upcoming streaming video player product codenamed Pinewood and focusing on other projects.

items.title: The best foldable phone you can buy
Trump's Tariffs Pause Could Help Nintendo Ship More Switch 2s
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- President Trump's 90-day pause on high tariffs may benefit Nintendo by allowing more shipments of the new Switch 2 from Vietnam to the US.
- Nintendo has been stockpiling Switch 2 units, ahead of its launch on June 5th, as customs data indicates increased shipments from Vietnam.
- Previously, a 46% tariff was placed on Vietnam, delaying Nintendo's planned preorders for April 9th in the US, but the current 10% tariff now applies to consoles shipped from Vietnam.

items.title: Sony is now selling both Last of Us games in one package
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The new Last of Us complete collection features enhanced PS5 versions of both games, aimed at new players following the HBO series.
- The downloadable version of the collection is available now, while the physical collector’s edition will release on July 10th.
- The physical edition includes a steelbook case, art prints, and comic books, and will be exclusive to PlayStation’s own shop.

items.title: Apple quickly shipped 600 tons of iPhones to ‘beat’ the new tariffs
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Apple airshipped 600 tons of iPhones to the US from India before new tariffs took effect.
- Approximately 1.5 million devices were shipped since March to avoid price increases.
- Apple lobbied for faster customs clearance and temporarily increased production by 20%. 
- Other companies like Dell, Microsoft, and Lenovo also rushed to ship premium devices before tariff deadlines.
- Some suppliers faced challenges in meeting the shipping demand in time for the tariffs.

items.title: The tariff apocalypse has not been canceled
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- President Trump implemented a series of tariffs against various countries, causing market reactions and delays on product preorders.
- A 90-day pause was announced, but many tariffs remain in effect, especially on goods from China, Canada, and Mexico.
- Tariffs range from 10% to 104% on goods, contributing to ongoing trade tensions and uncertainty in international relations.

items.title: Here come the e-bikes using DJI’s excellent Avinox drive system
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Several bicycle brands announced their first e-bikes using DJI’s Avinox drive system, including brands like Forbidden, Unno, Smartmotion, and Megamo.
- The Avinox drive system features a powerful 1000W motor capable of producing 120Nm of max torque.
- This is DJI's initial entry into the e-bike market, previously seen in a mid-drive electric mountain bike by Amflow.
